help: Welcome to House Explorer! This game is a work in progress. Try these commands to interact with your environment:
look                   Show the description of the current location.
look at <thing>        Show the description of the <thing>.
inventory              List the items in your inventory.
take <item>            Add an item to your inventory.
drop <item>            Remove an item from your inventory.

BOTTOM_OF_DRIVEWAY.name: Bottom of Driveway
BOTTOM_OF_DRIVEWAY.description: You are standing at the bottom of a driveway. There is a mid-sized ranch house to the north with a large front yard with some trees and bushes.

TOP_OF_DRIVEWAY.name: Top of Driveway
TOP_OF_DRIVEWAY.description: You are now directly in front of the house. The driveway is full of cracks and the house looks abandoned. There is a path to the backyard to the north, as well as a mailbox next to the front door. A basketball hoop is mounted on the house.

STREET_3.name: Street in Front of House
STREET_3.description: You are standing in the middle of the street. A white house is to the north. Forest lines the south side of the street as far as you can see.

FOREST.name: The Forest
FOREST.description: The trees around you are tall and thick. The ground is covered in fallen leaves and branches. The air is cool and calm.

HOUSE_FAR.name: house
HOUSE_FAR.description: The house has brick walls with white sidings. The house looks decrepit and there is no sign of anyone living here.

MAILBOX.description: This is a standard mailbox sitting on a wooden post.

LEAFLET.description: Welcome to House Explorer! This is a small tech demo built on the text-adventure game engine.

BASKETBALL.description: It is round and orange with bumps all over.
BASKETBALL.description_for_room: A basketball sits dejectedly on the side of the driveway.

HOUSE_NEAR.name: house
HOUSE_NEAR.description: Several windows are boarded up, the rest are covered in grime. The bushes around the house are overgrown.

FOREST_TREES.name: trees
FOREST_TREES.description: The trees tower up into the sky. Their branches stretch to form a canopy, blocking sunlight.
